alert.note: Alert for Ford; Iroquois (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 17 at 4:21AM CST until February 17 at 9:00PM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM CST/8 AM EST/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by heavy rain, snowmelt, and break-up ice jams continues to be possible through early this morning. * WHERE...Portions of east central Illinois including Ford and Iroquois Counties and portions of northwest Indiana including Benton, Jasper and Newton Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 AM CST/8 AM EST/ this morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Some rivers are forecast to go above flood stage based upon current forecast rainfall. Rising river levels may result in river ice becoming dislodged, increasing the risk of localized break-up ice jams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Rainfall of one to locally one and a quarter inches will have fallen through early this morning, in addition to runoff from melting snow. Frozen ground may lead to quick runoff. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch means flooding is possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Persons with interests along area rivers, creeks, and other waterways should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
